abstracts.cdata!:
The credits involved in this Cotton
            Sector Adjustment Program Project support the
            Government's adjustment program for the cotton sector
            which aims at reducing the inefficiencies of the cotton
            industry and paving the way for a broader based agricultural
            development strategy in heretofore cotton areas.  The
            program hopes to attain improved efficiency by implementing
            reforms in the incentive and institutional framework for
            cotton production.  The reform of the incentive system
            provides for the cotton processing industry to operate
            within a schedule of pre-determined margins for the
            elimination of input subsidies for the introduction of a
            more flexible producer pricing system for the payment of an
            export subsidy and for the creation of a Cotton Fund managed
            by the cotton industry.  The institutional reform, on the
            other hand, aims at strengthening the capacity of support
            services to alleviate productivity bottlenecks at farm level
            and identify crop diversification possibilities.  The
            adjustment program will extend over three years and be
            supported by follow-up adjustment credits.
